for some reason I got the "Welcome to Curb" email twice? specimen here is the "first" one FWIW, though the two look identical

the "password settings change" specimen is just the same page as the initial settings, with the password dialog open

/profile is also available at /myaccount, not a redirect

Password does, in fact, appear to confirm all the way to the end, no truncation: appended a different suffix and it was rejected

## password reset

the signin page directs back to https://my.gocurb.com/myaccount (not /profile like you get directed to post-registration), but if you load it up in another session and request reset, the token loads fine

submitting the request loads https://my.gocurb.com/reset_passwords which is just an alias for signin with a flash message, requesting a nonexistent account flashes "Registration not found." rather than "Please check your mail."

Resetting the password while logged in leads to a stub, no change in session

Ohhhh, looks like password reset doesn't expire after use - just did it again from the same link

signing out to see if the second one actually took... omg it did

Just signed out and now it's redirecting to the my.gocurb.com root on load, I think the expiration is 20 minutes

uploading this password reset change form as the specimen... it's got a "Sign Out" in the header, despite not being signed in

the reset stub *also* looks like you're signed in when you're not

## Phone verification

so, there's "verification" for the mobile number, but not the email?

trying the Tempophone number, it's not showing any texts after I hit the "Verify" button. maybe there's only one phone number a day, and the one I tried (1 631-481-8651, https://tempophone.com/phone/30/events) was obsolete?

anyway, verification requires *sending* a text *back*, so it wouldn't be possible anyway.

I just tried texting the newer test number from my own phone and I'm not even seeing my test text so it looks like that's probably dead in the water anyway
